CertForm.name: Z-Wave Plus v2 Certification
CertForm.formDescription: This is the Z-Wave Plus v2 certification form for General Products, Software and Hardware Devices. This form must be used if the product uses 700 series chips.
CertForm.formChangeLog:
r5
PI.3.1.1.*, PI.3.2.1.* - SDK list updated PI.3.1.3.2.2-4 - New SOC part numbers added PI.3.1.3.1.1 - Changed to ZGM130S037HGN2 / ZGM130S037HGN1 - 700 Series PI.3.1.3.1.2, PI.3.1.3.2.5 - "New OPN" added for new chips not yet known/available PI.3.1.3.4 - Result column added PI.3.2.3.1.2 - Result column removed PI.3.2.3.1.3 - EOL notice for ZM5304 modules added, result column removed PI.3.2.3.2.2.2 - Result column removed PI.3.2.3.4 - Result column added PI.7 - Section reworked, changing sub group type to one_or_more, allowing multiple RF frequency selection, adding items for country selection PI.7.11 - Typo in note text fixed DR.1.* - Other Device/Role Typ items: usage note added, Tag Name removed DR.1.6, DR.1.11, DR.1.12, DR.1.13, DR.1.18 - Changed DTs and Tag Names to begin with upper-case letters DR.1.17, DR.1.18 - Text adjusted to 2019D spec additions MCE.1.1.2 - Renamed End Point Type from Normal to Static MCE.1.1.3 - Fixed DT names, added sub types for Color Switch, Motorized Barrier and Window Covering DTs MCE.1.1.4 - Result column removed MCE.1.1.4.1 - Command Class name for Schedule Entry Lock CCs fixed, Meter V6 and Battery V2 added, Protection V3 removed DT.* - Changed DTs to begin with upper-case letters DT.1.4, DT.5.4, DT.9.4, DT.10.4, DT.11.4, DT.12.4, DT.13.4, DT.13.5, DT.15.5, DT.16.6, DT.17.7, DT.17.8, DT.17.10, DT.17.11, DT.17.12, DT.18.5 - Link adjusted to redirected Wiki page DT.3.1.1, DT.3.1.2 - Adding result columns DT.3.3.1 - Required Command Class version and form item relation fixed (to Color Switch, version 3) DT.14.5 - Form item header fixed, result column added DT.17 - Additional text and requirement added according the 2019D spec change DT.17.1, DT.18.1 - Item added for new requirement DT.17.7, DT.17.9, DT.7.11, DT.18.5.5 - Result columns removed DT.19.1 - Item removed (abbreviation for other Device Type) RT.1.7, RT.1.15, RT.1.17 - Result column removed RT.1.8, RT.1.8.1, RT.1.8.2, RT.1.9 - Removing old RT.1.8, adding new items for Lifeline Configuration requirements RT.1.10, RT.1.14, RT.1.15 - Items removed due to spec restructuring RT.2.8, RT.2.9, RT.2.11, RT.2.12.1 - Result column removed RT.2.10.1 - Note for ZWPv2 added, mandatory due to CL:0084.01.21.01.2 RT.2.10.2, RT.2.10.2.1 - Items removed RT.2.11, RT.2.12 - Moved RT.2.12 below RT.2.11.1 RT.4.6 - New item for RPC - Lifeline Configuration requirement RT.4.8 - Item removed (replaced by Lifeline Configuration requirement) RT.4.9.2, RT.4.10 - Result column removed RT.5.4, RT.5.5, RT.7.3.2, RT.7.4 - Result column removed RT.10 - Tage Name adjusted to "ROLE_TYPE_OTHER" CDR.5.1 - Addition requirement text from 2019C spec added CDR.8, CDR.8.1.2, CDR.12, CDR.14.1, CDR.18, CDR.22 - Result column removed CDR.17 - Result column removed CCA.15.4 - Non-existing Command Class removed CCA.35.6 - Meter Command Class v6 added CCA.46.3 - Protection Command Class v3 removed CCA.58.2 - Sound Switch v2 added CCA.61.5 - Thermostat Fan Mode v5 added CCA.69 - Sub items type changed to one_or_more, allowing multiple selection of Other Command Classes CCM.5.2 - Battery Command Class v2 added CCM.7.7 - Firmware Update Meta Command Class v7 added CCM.11, CCM.19 - Wiki link removed CCN.10.4 - CC removed (Z/IP CC V5 does not exist in current spec) CSR.2 ... 8 - Result column removed CSR.3.7 - New parent item created, former CSR.3.7, CSR.3.8 became sub-items CSR.3.7.1, CSR.3.7.2 CSR.3.7.4, CSR.3.7.5 - New items added for CC:0085.03.00.31.004, CC:0085.03.00.31.006 and CC:0085.03.00.31.005 CSR.8.2, CSR.8.12, CSR.8.15, CSR.8.19 - Result column removed CCR.1.1.10, CCR.1.1.11, CCR.1.16, CCR.1.2.4 - Result column removed CCR.1.1.16 - Additional choice items for MAY requirement added CCR.1.2.4 - Moved to CSR.3.7 (became new parent item) CCR.1.2.4.1 - Moved to CSR.3.7.3 SR.1.1, SR.1.2, SR.1.2.6 - Result column removed SR.2.8, SR.2.8.1, SR.2.8.2, SR.2.9, SR.2.10.9, SR.2.10.10 - Result column removed SR.3.2, SR.3.3.1, SR.3.3.1.5, SR.3.3.2, SR.3.3.3, SR.3.4.1.3 - Result column removed SR.3.7.2 - Requirement changed from MUST to SHOULD, requirement number adjusted SSR.2.1, SSR.2.4, SSR.2.11, SSR.2.11.1.2 - Result column removed CR.7 - Usage of ZIP Gateway made optional CR.7.2, CR.8.2 - Z/IP Gateway and Z-Ware version list updated RD.10 - New item for Basic Mapping requirement AGD.1, CPD.1 - Parent item for Association Group / Configuration Parameter data added AGD.1.1.6 - Command Classes and Command field change to a single field where the whole byte array has to be entered. CPD.1.1.5 - Result column removed MSD.1.* - Updated list of Multilevel Sensor Types and Scales according to 2019D spec MD.1, MSD.1, ND.1 - Result columns added MD.1.*, MSD.1.* - Size and Precision field have been added below each implemented Scale MD.1.*.2 - Adding 0x00 - Unspecified to rate types (for v1 compatibility) MD.1.1.1.8 - Changed to 0x08 - kVar MD.1.1.1.9 - Changed to 0x09 - kVarh MD.1.4.1.1.2 - Precision values for Heating Meter type fixed (3 was missing) H.2.1 - Result column removed H.2.1.1 - Set normal result columns for Verification and Adhoc test

formItem.itemTitle: All purchase orders for Z-Wave ASICs/Modules MUST be matched to specific device certifications
formItem.itemDescription:
• Purchase orders that cannot be matched to device certifications will be placed on hold
  • This section provides the details needed by Silicon Labs Sales Department to match the PO to the certification

The company placing the purchase orders for the Z-Wave modules/ASICs MUST include the Z-Wave Certification Number on the PO.
This identifies what company the submitted device is for.

formItem.itemNote: Select this option if the device will be sold/marketed under the submitting company's brand to one or more resellers/customers.
Select this option if the device will be manufactured for a different company using their brand and sold by them to resellers or end users.
This section is to identify any development partners or contractors involved in the project

formItem.itemDescription: Company Owned Facility - No Outside Contractors/Partners

formItem.itemNote: If the contract manufacturer will be placing the purchase orders for the Z-Wave modules/ASICS then they MUST include the certification number for this device on their P.O.

formItem.itemTitle: Type of Z-Wave Plus v2 Certification

formItem.itemNote:
New certifications MUST be based on Active or Maintained SDKs.

This selection is for new devices, not a variation of a previously certified device (unless there are major changes being made). Please refer to the Certification Overview document for details and examples.
Refer to the Certification Overview and/or Fee Schedule to determine whether the changes being made qualify this submission as a Product Modification or a Limited Product Modification.

formItem.itemDescription: Issues in previous Z-Wave Plus v2 certification attempt of same product
Update of a certified Z-Wave device to Z-Wave Plus v2
formItem.itemNote: Due to the number of changes required to convert a classic or Z-Wave Plus device to Z-Wave Plus v2 and the level of testing required to verify compliance to Z-Wave Plus v2 specifications, these updates do not qualify as re-certifications.

The "Clone for Re-Certification" function MUST be used to create Re-Certification cases.
Re-Certifications MUST be based on Active, Maintained or Monitored SDKs.

formItem.itemDescription: Certification or Case Number this submission is based on.

formItem.itemNote: Refer to the Certification Overview and/or Fee Schedule to determine whether the changes being made qualify this submission as a Product Modification or a Limited Product Modification.

formItem.itemDescription: Limited issues in previous Z-Wave Plus v2 certification attempt of same product

formItem.itemNote: Make sure you have selected Silicon Labs as the test partner for this.

formItem.itemDescription: Technical change that does not affect Z-Wave network behavior (review only) - Describe changes below
formItem.itemNote: Make sure you have selected Silicon Labs as the test partner for this.
Hardware and software of product are being certified

formItem.itemDescription: DUT has an integrated Z-Wave ASIC/Module
DUT utilizes an add-on Z-Wave ASIC/Module in a standard hardware interface
formItem.itemNote: Examples: USB stick, Raspberry Pi daughter-card

formItem.itemDescription: Add-On is being certified with this device and will be included with it when shipped
formItem.itemNote: Note: Add-On cannot be sold or shipped separately!

formItem.itemDescription: Z-Wave Plus v2 Software Application Product
formItem.itemNote: Software is certified; requires Certified Z-Wave Platform product to run on

formItem.itemDescription: Z-Wave Plus v2 Hardware Platform Product
formItem.itemNote: Hardware together with sample application software is being certified; must use and expose standard Z-Wave Plus v2 Serial API to host application (not a standalone end user product)

formItem.itemTitle: Z-Wave Plus Developer’s Kit version (API version)
formItem.itemNote: New Z-Wave products can only be certified provided they are based on “Active or “Maintained” Z-Wave releases. Recertifications may also be based on or “Monitored” Z-Wave releases. (“Beta” and “Obsolete” Z-Wave releases cannot be used). Beta releases can be identified by a trailing “0” in the main branch identifier. Examples include 5.00, 4.50 and 6.50 (the trailing zero is underlined). Please do not confuse this with a new active SDK like 4.55.00 or 6.51.00 where the “00” is used to identify it as the initial release.
Allowed for new products until January 24th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until January 24th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until January 24th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until January 24th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until January 24th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until January 24th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until November 26th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until July 12th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until March 29th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Too new to be listed on form

Use of anything other than the latest release of the ZDK <u>requires</u> your acknowledgment that there are updates available and that you have elected to use an earlier version which may provide less functionality. A brief explanation why you are not using the latest version is also required.
The library used MUST have been published by Silicon Labs and support all of the functionality required in the Z-Wave Plus Device and Role Type specifications (SDS14224 and SDS11846).

formItem.itemTitle: Chipset Used and Form of Integration

formItem.itemDescription: Standard Z-Wave module is used in product.
formItem.itemNote: Cannot be modified and must be implemented in accordance with Silicon Labs’ specifications.

formItem.itemDescription: Z-Wave chip directly integrated into product. (Standard Z-Wave module has not been used)
formItem.itemNote: It is highly recommended that you review this with your Silicon Labs FAE.

formItem.itemDescription: Z-Wave Plus v2 Software Application Product
formItem.itemNote: Specify the hardware platform/product that has been used to test the application program.

formItem.itemDescription: This hardware platform / product MUST be Z-Wave Plus v2 certified
formItem.itemNote: The application and hardware need to be certified as a General Z-Wave Plus v2 device if the hardware platform is not already Z-Wave Plus v2 certified.

formItem.itemTitle: Z-Wave Plus Developer’s Kit version (API version)
formItem.itemNote: New Z-Wave products can only be certified provided they are based on “Active or “Maintained” Z-Wave releases. Recertifications may also be based on or “Monitored” Z-Wave releases. (“Beta” and “Obsolete” Z-Wave releases cannot be used). Beta releases can be identified by a trailing “0” in the main branch identifier. Examples include 5.00, 4.50 and 6.50 (the trailing zero is underlined). Please do not confuse this with a new active SDK like 4.55.00 or 6.51.00 where the “00” is used to identify it as the initial release.
Allowed for new products until April 13th, 2021. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until October 8th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until July 19th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until May 20th, 2020. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until November 9th, 2019. May be used for re-certifications.
Allowed for new products until November 9th, 2019. May be used for re-certifications.
Too new to be listed on form

Use of anything other than the latest release of the ZDK <u>requires</u> your acknowledgment that there are updates available and that you have elected to use an earlier version which may provide less functionality. A brief explanation why you are not using the latest version is also required.
The library used MUST have been published by Silicon Labs and support all of the functionality required in the Z-Wave Plus Device and Role Type specifications (SDS14224 and SDS11846).

formItem.itemTitle: Chipset Used and Form of Integration

formItem.itemDescription: Standard Z-Wave module is used in product.
formItem.itemNote: Cannot be modified and must be implemented in accordance with Silicon Labs’ specifications.
General Purpose SIP Module
Pin compatible with ZM3102 & ZM4102 modules
868MHz
908MHz
921MHz

Serial Interface Module with Antenna; MUST only be used with the Static Controller or Bridge Controller Library and is only allowed for use in Central Static Controller (CSC) and Sub Static Controller (SSC) Role Types. ONLY BINARIES GENERATED BY SILICON LABS & INTENDED FOR THE MODEM SERIES ARE ALLOWED

EOL (End of Life) has been announced for all ZM5304 modules with an effective data of December 1st, 2020.
868MHz
908MHz
921MHz

formItem.itemDescription: Z-Wave chip directly integrated into product. (Standard Z-Wave module has not been used)
formItem.itemNote: It is highly recommended that you review this with your Silicon Labs FAE. This implementation requires separate QFN testing at an additional cost.
General Purpose SoC

Serial Interface SoC; MUST only be used with the Static Controller or Bridge Controller Library and is only allowed for use in Central Static Controller (CSC) and Sub Static Controller (SSC) Role Types. <u>ONLY BINARIES GENERATED BY SILICON LABS & INTENDED FOR THE MODEM SERIES ARE ALLOWED</u>
Must be QFN Certified

formItem.itemDescription: Z-Wave Plus v2 Software Application Product
formItem.itemNote: Specify the hardware platform/product that has been used to test the application program.

formItem.itemDescription: This hardware platform / product MUST be Z-Wave Plus v2 certified
formItem.itemNote: The application and hardware need to be certified as a General Z-Wave Plus v2 device if the hardware platform is not already Z-Wave Plus v2 certified.

formItem.itemDescription: The product is based on a standard Z-Wave stack.
The entire application runs on the Z-Wave chip (Embedded system).
The application runs at least partially on a second micro-controller (Embedded system).
The application runs on a second micro-controller – The standard Z-Wave Serial API is used.
The application runs on a second micro-controller – A modified Z-Wave Serial API is used.
Software Applications ONLY / NOT for General Products
The application runs on a PC – The application uses the standard Z-Wave Serial API (either directly or hidden through another library layer)
The application runs on a PC – The application does not use the standard Z-Wave Serial API (either directly or hidden through another library layer)
AC Adapter or Other External Power Supply
The product can also be operated with 50Hz
The product can also be operated with 60Hz
Use the below items to select all frequencies and regions or countries that apply for your product.
formItem.itemNote: Note: Please see the "Where Z-Wave Works" listing on Silabs technical support page for more information.
Used in the following countries: Australia, Brazil, Chile, Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Indonesia, Malaysia, New Zealand, Paraguay, Peru, Uruguay, Venezuela, Vietnam

formItem.itemTitle: Select the Device and Role Type of your product
formItem.itemDescription:
Please select the primary Device and Role Type of your product here. Information regarding self-testing can be found in the Wiki which is accessed by clicking on the ? icons in the individual line items.

If the product is a Multiple NIF device with more than one Role Type, please select all implemented Role Types in this section.

formItem.itemNote:
This can only be used if a Role Type for this Device Type is stated in the Specifications but is not yet listed in the form.

The Role Type name has to be specified in the Role Type form section.

formItem.itemDescription:
The Gateway Device Type is intended for all gateway controllers that provide access in and potentially out of the Z-Wave network as well as extensive controlling capabilities over Z-Wave. This DT MAY provide transparent access for all types of IP Packets between several network technologies.

The Gateway DT MUST be used if the Client/Application UI is running on somewhere else than the same box or LAN network where the controller is running.
formItem.itemNote: Note: The Gateway DT is the correct replacement for all CSC based Controllers from the Z-Wave Plus v1 program.

This can only be used if a Role Type for this Device Type is stated in the Specifications but is not yet listed in the form.

The Role Type name has to be specified in the Role Type form section.

formItem.itemDescription:
The Generic Controller Device Type is intended for all more constrained or simple controllers allowing users to make basic use of the Z-Wave network and controlling a pre-defined set of actuator nodes as well as unknown actuator nodes.

The Generic controller DT MUST NOT be used if the Client/Application UI is running somewhere else then the same box or LAN network where the controller is running.
formItem.itemNote: Note: The Gateway DT is the correct replacement for all CSC based Controllers from the Z-Wave Plus v1 program.

This can only be used if a Role Type for this Device Type is stated in the Specifications but is not yet listed in the form.

The Role Type name has to be specified in the Role Type form section.

This can only be used if a Device Type is stated in the Specifications but is not yet listed in the form.

Enter Device Type name here:

This can only be used if a Role Type for this Device Type is stated in the Specifications but is not yet listed in the form.

The Role Type name has to be specified in the Role Type form section.
